meanings.sent1: She fell down and landed right on her tuchus.
meanings.sent2: After sitting for a long time, his tuchus started to feel sore.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those heavy bags made her tuchus ache.
meanings.sent4: The toddler's tuchus wiggled as he tried to stand up.
meanings.sent5: The cold bench sent a shiver through her tuchus.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone on the buttocks as a form of punishment or discipline.
meanings.sent1: The coach would tuchus the players lightly during practice.
meanings.sent2: Parents should never tuchus their children in anger.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to tuchus his friend for being late.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to tuchus the rule-breaker to maintain order.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the paddle tuchusing echoed in the room.
